name: New Sanno Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is immaculate, and the decor is actually attractive instead of "hotel pretty."
reviews.title: Could NOT have been better

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything to put here.

reviews.title: Great deal and a great time!
reviews.text: Starbucks coffee in the room to start the day, and affordable room service options from breakfast-dinner. We had the breakfast buffet at Emporium a couple of times, for $8, and it was good, with made-to-order omelets.
The ATM was helpful, as was the post office and pack-n-ship in the basement.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the New Sanno

reviews.text: The absolute best feature was the concierge staff. They are very knowledgeable and patient, and must have made 20 maps for me. They made it so easy to get out and see the city, even telling me how to buy the subway tokens.
reviews.title: widows not welcome

likes.liked: — unremarried widow(er)s of military retirees are persona non-grata

reviews.title: Wonderful Oasis in Tokyo
reviews.text: I didn't want to check out after our week was up.
I'm currently stationed in Okinawa and stayed at the New Sanno for the Memorial Day weekend, what a nice place for military members to stay!!!
reviews.title: A very nice place to stay

reviews.text: It has virtually everything you'll need!
reviews.title: Best of the Best
Paradise in the Far East
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and comfortable. I had the Sunday brunch and it was MARVELOUS! There was so much food I had to go back 5 times to try everything! It was beautifully arranged. Oh and the Sunrise Cafe had the BEST pastries! The guys there were very friendly and funny.

I can't say enough about the tickets and tours desk. The ladies there were so helpful and the directions they gave to many different areas of Tokyo were exact. I never felt like we were going to get lost in the city.
reviews.title: A 5 star military hotel!!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is top of the line for military establishments! It has reasonably priced restuarants, a Starbucks, a pool with sauna and hot tub, an Exchange, and much more. The Heros restaurant was open until 11pm for those late night snackers. The rooms are clean and nicely presented with WiFi and mini refrigerator. Fresh towels daily and oh so soft toilet paper :) Each morning a newspaper was placed at our door. I was very impressed with all the amenities it offered.
reviews.title: An absolutely perfect experience

reviews.text: Although it is located in the city, it is within walking distance to the subway for easy access to other parts of Tokyo.
reviews.title: The only way to go

likes.liked: — Has everything you need, and very inexpensive to eat
likes.disliked: — Pool area, definitely for 10 and under

reviews.text: I don't see how anyone can complain about The New Sanno.
reviews.title: Horrible welcome to Japan

likes.disliked: — did not get the room type I reserved, food was bad, 90 minutes from Narita, room was dirty, cheap motel

reviews.text: First off, the complaint about having to walk up a ramp and then on to the hotel entrance is ridiculous! It's all of 50 yards...who cares! Anyway, this hotel has it all. Fine dining, coffee shop w/Starbucks, pizza, family dining and much more. Rooms are everything you need but maybe not everything you want. Overall, a very pleasant surprise for a military hotel in the heart of Tokyo. Lastly, about 45 minutes on the train from Disney.
reviews.title: What a bargin for downtown Tokyo

likes.disliked: — Walk upstairs at subway station after a day of sightseeing.

reviews.text: After our long flight into Tokyo we were very excited to get to the New Sanno, eat dinner, and get to bed. Once we arrived by airport limo we had to pull all of our baggage (8 bags, car seat, and baby) up a long outdoor ramp to have our id's checked. Then another walk to the hotel entrance. Once we got inside we went to the desk to check in. I had booked on the hotel's website and marked the box for NO ROOM SUBSTITUTIONS. Well they ignored my request and now we were stuck in a room with one bed for the 4 of us. I was not very happy and extremely tired. So we figured we would make do versus going out into Tokyo at night to try and find another room. We get into our room which was more like a motel room, and order room service. It took 45 minutes for room service to arrive so in the mean time I got ready for bed, pulled back the sheets to find several large hair balls in our ONE bed! That was the final straw for me. It was a cheap motel trying to impersonate an expensive resort. I will never stay here again! I would much rather spend the money and have a nice comfortable and reliable place to sleep!!! This place is nasty!
reviews.title: Incredible value

reviews.text: If you’re a service member visiting Tokyo then there's no question were you want to stay. This hotel offers all the little things that are convenient to military personnel traveling in a foreign country. A mini exchange, restaurants, bank, indoor pool, the sanno has it all. The rooms are American style with large beds and western toilets, which you don't always get in some Japanese hotels. It has a great breakfast buffet every morning and the other restaurants inside the hotel are all high quality and rival any restaurant you could go to in Tokyo. Conveniently located near the subway and in the popular Roppungi district, the sanno is in an ideal location for getting around Tokyo. Great rates, you can't beat the prices.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Tokyo!
Make sure of your reservations
reviews.text: Being a canadian retired serviceman , we always used the US. facilities almost anywhere in the world. Their hotels, lodgings, always welcomed us. So when we found the New Sanno Hotel in Tokyo, we made some reservations for a few days at the end of our trip in Japan. We had contacted many times the reservation room for confirmation and even just before our departure from Canada. Someone named Nana answered back that everything was fine. So we showed up there with our suitcases just to be rejected at the gate. Apparently it is only for american soldiers active and retired. All these months that we had our reservations NOBODY had the common sense of telling us that we couldn't as canadian. Because of their negligence we ended up late , in the rain, dragging our suitcases looking for a hotel in Tokyo. Their manager send us to a very bad hotel -The Shinagawa Prince Hotel, across from the train station. This hotel is in a very bad condition and more than $200. per night. Which was twice what we had budgeted for Tokyo. So thanks to incompetence from the New Sanno reservation room we had a not so good last days in Tokyo.

Very few 'perks' exist for active duty and retired military types nowadays but this one ranks right at the top. Well appointed decor, excellent staff, and great price/value. Convenient location for doing all the touristy things available in Tokyo. The hotel has a Tours Desk to help you decide what to do during your stay. The dining opportunities available at the hotel range through a large gamut: A breakfast coffee/pastry snack bar, a traditional style sandwich snack bar, a coffee shop style dining room, a Japanese restaurant and culminate at an elegant gourmet dining room with ala carte or fixed price offerings. The fixed price menu offers some rather exotic choices and is very reasonably priced at slightly less than $50.00 per adult. This is a very enjoyable dining experience. On Sunday an all you can eat buffet for less than $25.00 per adult is available. One day laundry/dry cleaning is available through room service plus a well maintained coin operated laundry facility in the basement. DVD movies are available through the desk at a minimal charge. Cautions!!! Taking the train/subway from the Narita airport to the hotel is a cultural experience but it involves lots (No, Really! Lots) of stairs climbing at some stations. Take the bus (see the hotel site for info) as it offers basically door to door convenience and is also quite a bargain at about $30.00 per person. Taking a taxi from the airport to the hotel or anywhere in the downtown Tokyo area costs approximately $250.00 - one way!! The hotel only has 149 rooms so make your reservations as early as possible - you'll be glad you did.
reviews.title: The New Sanno Hotel is a Jewel in the Orient!

likes.disliked: — It's too far for me to visit more often.

reviews.text: Ditto most of the other reviews. Not only is this a phenomenal deal for downtown Tokyo, the rooms are spacious for an Asian big city hotel. Add in the great price and it's an incredible deal.
reviews.title: Great value, including the restaurant

likes.disliked: — It can be a bit hard to find. Follow the directions from the hotel, but all the sudden you're wlking along a city block and, bam, there's the New Sanno!

reviews.text: Also, try the restaurant. We were amazed at the prices in Tokyo restaurants. And typically, I find hotel food to be overpriced and not inspiring. The Japanese restaurant at the New Sanno, though, is a great deal and very good. One of the best meals we had particularly at that price.
reviews.title: Best deal around!

description: This hotel is open only to holders of specific United States Military Identification cards. Please contact the hotel directly for further information.
